Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Shep I (3-28) (Shepherin I fragment, Synthetic AMPs, Gly-rich, His-rich, UCLL1; Derivative: Shep I (3-28)a; BBII, metallo-AMPs)

Literature.Author: Remuzgo C, Oewel TS, Daffre S, Lopes TR, Dyszy FH, Schreier S, Machado-Santelli GM, Teresa Machini M.2014
Literature.Title: Chemical synthesis, structure-activity relationship, and properties of shepherin I: a fungicidal peptide enriched in glycine-glycine-histidine motifs.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 92.86% similar toShepherin IG: 69%, H: 31%.Activity: active against C. albicans MDM8 (MIC 25 uM), C.albicans ATCC 90028 (MIC>100 uM), C. albicans HU 168 (MIC 100 uM), C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 (MIC 6.25 uM), C.krusei ATCC 6258 (MIC >100 uM), C. tropicalis Squibb 1600 (MIC 3.13 uM),  and S. cerevisiae ATCC 2601 (MIC 25 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans MDM8 (4.3-137.0 mM).SAR: C-terminal amidation, i.e. Shep I (3-28)a, enhanced this peptide antifungal activity.Provided by Maria TerÃªsa Machini 11/2024
